item.title: Emily add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "War is what happens when language fails." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Emily add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "Perhaps I write for no one. Perhaps for the same person children are writing for when they scrawl their names in the snow." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Emily add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "In the spring, at the end of the day, you should smell like dirt." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Emily add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "If you knew what was going to happen, if you knew everything that was going to happen next—if you knew in advance the consequences of your own actions—you'd be doomed. You'd be ruined as God. You'd be a stone. You'd never eat or drink or laugh or get out of bed in the morning. You'd never love anyone, ever again. You'd never dare to." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Emily add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "The only way you can write the truth is to assume that what you set down will never be read. Not by any other person, and not even by yourself at some later date. Otherwise you begin excusing yourself. You must see the writing as emerging like a long scroll of ink from the index finger of your right hand; you must see your left hand erasing it." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Emily add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "It was a bright cold day in April, and the clocks were striking thirteen." -- George Orwell

item.title: Emily add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "The very least you can do in your life is figure out what you hope for. And the most you can do is live inside that hope. Not admire it from a distance but live right in it, under its roof." -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: Emily add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "The world is indeed full of peril, and in it there are many dark places; but still there is much that is fair, and though in all lands love is now mingled with grief, it grows perhaps the greater." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Emily add a quote by J. D. Salinger
item.description: "Anyway, I keep picturing all these little kids playing some game in this big field of rye and all. Thousands of little kids, and nobody's around - nobody big, I mean - except me. And I'm standing on the edge of some crazy cliff. What I have to do, I have to catch everybody if they start to go over the cliff - I mean if they're running and they don't look where they're going I have to come out from somewhere and catch them. That's all I do all day. I'd just be the catcher in the rye and all. I know it's crazy, but that's the only thing I'd really like to be." -- J. D. Salinger

item.title: Emily add a quote by Shah Rukh Khan
item.description: "Walk on with hope in your heart, and you'll never walk alone" -- Shah Rukh Khan

item.title: Emily add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "Strange as it may seem, I still hope for the best, even though the best, like an interesting piece of mail, so rarely arrives, and even when it does it can be lost so easily." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Emily add a quote by Stephen Jay Gould
item.description: "We pass through this world but once. Few tragedies can be more extensive than the stunting of life, few injustices deeper than the denial of an opportunity to strive or even to hope, by a limit imposed from without, but falsely identified as lying within." -- Stephen Jay Gould

item.title: Emily add a quote by Carl Sandburg
item.description: "A baby is God's opinion that the world should go on." -- Carl Sandburg

item.title: Emily add a quote by Nelson Mandela
item.description: "I am fundamentally an optimist. Whether that comes from nature or nurture, I cannot say. Part of being optimistic is keeping one's head pointed toward the sun, one's feet moving forward. There were many dark moments when my faith in humanity was sorely tested, but I would not and could not give myself up to despair. That way lays defeat and death." -- Nelson Mandela

item.title: Emily add a quote by Dalai Lama XIV
item.description: "There is a saying in Tibetan, 'Tragedy should be utilized as a source of strength.' No matter what sort of difficulties, how painful experience is, if we lose our hope, that's our real disaster." -- Dalai Lama XIV

item.title: Emily add a quote by Paulo Coelho
item.description: "When we love, we always strive to become better than we are. When we strive to become better than we are, everything around us becomes better too." -- Paulo Coelho

item.title: Emily add a quote by Ellen Hopkins
item.description: "in a woman's womb. another chance. to make the world better." -- Ellen Hopkins

item.title: Emily add a quote by Roger Hedden
item.description: "When you don't know where you're going, you drive on the highway." -- Roger Hedden

item.title: Emily add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "So we beat on, boats against the current, borne back ceaselessly into the past." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Emily add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "Listen. To live is to be marked. To live is to change, to acquire the words of a story, and that is the only celebration we mortals really know. In perfect stillness, frankly, I've only found sorrow." -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: Emily add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "God doesn’t need to punish us. He just grants us a long enough life to punish ourselves." -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: Emily add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "Don’t try to make life a mathematics problem with yourself in the center and everything coming out equal. When you’re good, bad things can still happen. And if you’re bad, you can still be lucky." -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: Emily add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "Everything you're sure is right can be wrong in another place. " -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: Emily add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "Morning always comes." -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: Emily add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "April is the cruelest month, T.S. Eliot wrote, by which I think he meant (among other things) that springtime makes people crazy. We expect too much, the world burgeons with promises it can't keep, all passion is really a setup, and we're doomed to get our hearts broken yet again. I agree, and would further add: Who cares? Every spring I go out there anyway, around the bend, unconditionally. ... Come the end of the dark days, I am more than joyful. I'm nuts. " -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: Emily add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "Thanks for this day, for all birds safe in their nests, for whatever this is, for life." -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: Emily add a quote by Bono
item.description: "Sometimes religion gets in the way of God." -- Bono

item.title: Emily add a quote by Bono
item.description: "Dream up the kind of world you want to live in. Dream out loud." -- Bono

item.title: Emily add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "I attempted briefly to consecrate myself in the public library, believing every crack in my soul could be chinked with a book." -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: Emily add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "If we can't, as artists, improve on real life, we should put down our pencils and go bake bread." -- Barbara Kingsolver
